thread.title: No. 1 teams on top college football levels playing in N.J. on Saturday
thread.title_full: No. 1 teams on top college football levels playing in N.J. on Saturday

author: Keith Sargeant | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: No. 1 teams on top college football levels playing in N.J. on Saturday
text:
No. 1 teams on top college football levels playing in N.J. on Saturday Monmouth quarterback Cody Williams Comments 
Coastal Carolina has won 36 of its last 42 games and currently sits atop the national FCS coaches poll. 
Ohio State has won 20 straight games and, at No. 1 in both major college football polls, sits in good position in its quest for a second consecutive National Championship. 
Both will be playing in New Jersey on Saturday, 30 miles away and seven hours apart. 
While Monmouth University hosts Coastal Carolina at 1 p.m. on its West Long Branch campus, Rutgers will welcome Ohio State for an 8 p.m. Big Ten clash at High Point Solutions Stadium. 
It's the first time ever that the No. 1 college football teams at the two highest levels — FBS (Division I-A) and FCS (Division I-AA) — will be playing in New Jersey on the same day. 
"I think it's not only great for college football, I think it's great for college football in the state of New Jersey,'' Monmouth coach Kevin Callahan said. "Rutgers and Monmouth draw a high percentage of our roster from the New Jersey talent base. To be able to have both No. 1 teams here, playing in New Jersey on the same day, I think it's great. 
"The only thing that would be better is if both Rutgers and Monmouth were No. 1 playing in New Jersey.'' 
While Callahan said he is anticipating "an electric atmosphere'' for his program's Homecoming affair, Rutgers coach Kyle Flood said "Saturday night will be the best atmosphere in all of college football'' when his team plays host to the top-ranked Buckeyes. 
PLUS: Kyle Flood expects raucous atmosphere for Ohio State 
"It's an exciting week for our program,'' Flood said. "We really enjoy being back in High Point Solutions Stadium. Our nighttime environment is one of the best in the country. We're looking forward to that.'' Cannon group celebrates Rutgers football score with a boom Jack Nelson portrays Henry Rutgers, a colonel in General Washington's artillery and early benefactor and namesake of Rutgers University. Nelson leads a group of revolutionary war reenactors who fire a blank charge from a cannon in the end zone following every Rutgers score at High Point Solutions Stadium in Piscataway. (Video by Andre Malok | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com) 
The fact that fans can take in both games isn't lost on Callahan, whose team is coming off its first-ever win over a ranked opponent last Saturday with an upset of then-No. 22-ranked Liberty. Now in their second year in the Big South Conference, the Hawks stand at 3-4 overall heading into their matchup against the Chanticleers. 
"I think the curious football fan will want to see what this Coastal Carolina football team is all about,'' said Callahan, who owns a 129-106 record in 23 seasons. "Hopefully they'll come out to watch our game and then hop in the car and go up to Rutgers for the 8 o'clock start up there. The people that really love college football it gives them the opportunity to see the No. 1 teams on both levels.'' 
Keith Sargeant may be reached at ksargeant@njadvancemedia.com . Follow him on Twitter @KSargeantNJ . Find NJ.com Rutgers Football on Facebook .
